intro: Exothea paniculata, commonly known as the panicled exothea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It produces woody fruits that contain flat, winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
